page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT - THREE MOSSES
page.content: The deployment of labour in The Three Mosses area is largely connected with agriculture. The packing of vegetables and salad produce. With the use of machinery the number employed on the farms are fewer than in the past, an average of 6 - 8 persons. Between the occupied shops 5 persons are employed, while at the largest boarding kennel 4 are employed on a full time basis, the other kennel has the 2 members of the family. The nursery employs three at present, while the Pumping station has three men on site. The manager of the pumping station lives in a bungalow on the site. The largest employer, L.O. Jeffs has a staff in excess of 220, some from the immediate area others are transported to work by private bus.
